citation.article-title: Rhizobium indigoferae sp. nov. and Sinorhizobium kummerowiae sp. nov., respectively isolated from Indigofera spp. and Kummerowia stipulacea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhizobium indigoferae sp. nov.
Rhizobium indigoferae (in.di.go'fe.rae. N.L. gen. n. indigoferae of Indigofera, a genus of leguminous plants, referring to the host from which the bacterium was isolated)
Cells are aerobic, Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods that are 0.4-0.7x1.5-2.6 μm.
Colonies are 2-3 mm in diameter after 2 days at 28°C and produce acid in YMA.
Generation time is 2.2-3.8 h in PY broth.
Can grow on YMA in the presence of 2.0% NaCl.
Optimum pH is 6.5-7.5; no growth at pH 5.0.
Uses dulcitol, D(+)-galactose, D-mannose, sodium citrate, salicin, sucrose, xylose and DL-asparagine, but not D-arabinose, calcium malonate or tartrate as sole carbon sources.
Uses L-cysteine, but not glycine or D-valine as a sole nitrogen source.
Sensitive to 100 μg kanamycin and chloramphenicol ml-1 and 300 μg streptomycin ml-1.
No strain can grow in medium with acridine hydrochloride (0.1%) or methyl green (0.1%).
Methylene blue reduction and nile-blue reduction are negative.
Strains have been isolated from Indigofera spp.
The DNA G+C content is 59.0-62.0 mol% (Tm).
The type strain is strain CCBAU 71042T (=AS 1.3054T).
Its generation time is 2.6 h and its DNA G+C content is 60.1 mol%(Tm).
